Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area; Pit is representative of backcountry; Pit is adjacent to avalanche: flank; Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; Recent avalanche activity on different slopes; Ski tracks on slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Skoðun á brotstáli í togsprungu aðliggjandi að flóði sem sprengt var í Púðurbakka 2.4 sl., sz #3. Greining á samsetningu fleka, veiks lags og rennslisflatar samanborið við önnur nýleg flóð á svæðinu.

Pit_Observation.activities: Cracking; Recent avalanche activity on different slopes; We snowmobiled slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Athugun á samsetningu og stöðugleika snjóþekju áveðursmegin gagnvart undangengnum norðanhríðum og tilheurandi snjóflóðahrinum. Kúptar brúnir ofan áveðurshlíða víða auðar eða ís- og/eða hjarnlagðar. Gryfjutökustaður lýsandi fyrir áveðursbrekkur á svæðinu í sambærilegri hæð. Óformlegar prófanir í sömu viðhorfum og svipaðri hæð sýna sambæirlega svörun og gryfjan. Sprungumyndanir í þunnum ofanáliggjandi vindlfeka á stöku stað.

Pit_Observation.activities: Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; Recent avalanche activity on different slopes;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Athugun á stöðugleika hlémegin eftir norðanhríðar sl tveggja vikna. Gryfjutökustaður lýsandi fyrir hléhlíðar í sambærilegri hæð. Gryfjutökustaður lýsandi fyrir skíðaleiðir á svæðinu.

Observed: CD Plotted: CD Site: Steep, convex short slope feature, above access road within cutblock at TL. Faces predominant flow pattern (windward). No shelter from solar input. Objective: General snowpack structure assessment prior to road re-establishment at the toe of the slope.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Moderate blowing snow was observed at ridge line. Moderate wind loading and scouring was observed, likely from M-S westerly winds in the previous days.

Pit_Observation.activities: Collapsing, localized; Recent avalanche activity on different slopes; Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Moderate blowing snow was observed at ridge line. Moderate wind loading and scouring was observed, likely from westerly winds in the previous days. Many d1-d2 wet loose and glide avalanches observed on solars that were several days old. Soft cold snow was found NW-NE above 5300FT

Pit_Observation.activities: Collapsing, widespread; Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; Recent avalanche activity on different slopes; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes:
North slope near top of Trimmer Peak. Pit dug in open area with scattered young trees around. The goal of the pit was to assess stability and snow consolidation after two recent storms and observed rapid warming and widespread instability the prior day.
This pit was dug in the morning prior to moderate warming observed throughout the day. At these elevations snow was stable and consolidated, showing no signs of propagation.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Note A: very minor cracking near this depth. Storm slab in this area was stubborn and mostly unreactive in general on ~30-35deg slopes. Cracks were in new soft storm snow. Pit_Observation.activities: Recent avalanche activity on different slopes;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Gryfja tekin í NNV vísandi hlíð undir Bassa í Burstabrekkudal. Niðurstöður stöðugleikaprófs sýndu töluverðan veikleika í nýja snjónum. Einnig voru teknar tvær aðrar skyndigryfjur í 720M hæð A vísandi hlíð (CT1@20CM SC og ECTP3@20CM) og í V vísandi hlíð (CT4@25CM SC).

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: FCsf above CR240222 is now well bonded and unreactive

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Winds were WSW on the ridgetops. No winds in protected areas mid slope. Snowpack surface was taking heat. Northerlies were still dry, but any sun at all and things were warming quickly out of the wind zone. East and South facing slopes were smoother, north was still dry snow and west facing had a breakable crust.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: OBJ: stabilitetstest i drevsnöflak.
Solen värmer på snöytan SO-S i ALP. + grader i luften och kramsnö på ytan i ALP vid testplats.
Nära startzon, SE Asp i Alp, stort snödjup. Representativt för de laviner som gick för fyra dagar sedan. Får förmiddagssol ett par timmar, men inte hela dagen.

Pit_Observation.activities: Cracking; Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Very isolated and minor cracking. Could get the cracks to travel up to a meter in a couple of rollovers of small test slopes. These were windslabs (~28 cm below snow surface) from 24 to 36 hours ago as well as more recent storm slabs (10-15cm below snow surface). The ECTN results reflect these layers.
Also dug on a SW facing slope on the other side of the ridge at the same elevation. At 3pm water had penetrated down 4 inches from the surface. The snow below was moist but not wet.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Intense Solar on test walls

Observers: BE, RC.
Did best to get snow moisture content quickly but could have been impacted by 11 deg temp and solar input.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area; Pit is representative of backcountry; Instability rapidly rising;
Pit dug in a Ski Area;

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: ALP. Drevsnö.

Water has only percolated down as far as the old/new interface from 3/9. The surface hoar at this depth has transitioned into melt forms and there is a slight ice layer at this depth as well. Pit score=9. Good structure, good energy, good strength.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Fracture line profile for sz 2 wet slab Xh result from previous day in compacted ski run. Smooth planar slope with sparse trees. Entire snowpack was isothermal (0 degrees). AG, CC.

Pit_Observation.activities: Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes:
There are a few slabs near the surface, but they do not slide easily: * For the one at 185cm, a very small crack near the edge is observed around CT15, but it crosses the column fully on CT21 and does not slide at all at this steep location. * For the one at 175cm, a crack appears across the whole column suddenly at CT24, but does not slide easily, it breaks up into pieces and slides off by CT26.
2 fairly large glide avalanches noted on southeastern slopes on nearby Baba Peak
ECTP result on 38 (past test protocol) at 154cm Snowpit done by Jason Boyer
